pull_request.title: Remove old versions of BIKE
pull_request.body:
- Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

This PR removes `bike1_l1_cpa`, `bike1_l3_cpa`, `bike1_l1_fo`, and `bike1_l3_fo`. Resolves #1024.


This PR also improves the compilation of round 3 BIKE. In particular the `cpu_features.h` file is now aware of both dist and non-dist builds and it selects the best available code in both cases.

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: Removing default algs
pull_request.body:
Begins to address #1043, retaining `OQS_MINIMAL_BUILDÂ´ option: The latter now can be fed with a string of algorithms to be enabled, disabling all others.

Current state meant as intermediate state to check with @jschanck whether this approach is OK. If so, actual removal of DEFAULT algs will be added to this PR.

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

pull_request.title: removing BIKE R2 from README
pull_request.body:
Correcting reference removal in #1045.
This intentionally does not fix the equally incorrect https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/main/docs/algorithms/kem/bike.md assuming that will be fixed soon by #1030.
